name: Quick and Easy Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'garlic cloves, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}

name: Instant Pot Pinto Beans (No Soaking)
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'bacon'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dried pinto beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onions, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green chile peppers'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}
steps: Gather the ingredients.. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function. Add bacon and cook, turning once, 4 to 6 minutes.. Add chicken broth, pinto beans, water, onions, chile peppers, garlic powder, salt, chili powder, cumin, and paprika. Close and lock the lid.. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 45 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.. Remove bacon and chile peppers; chop to desired consistency and return to the pot. Mash beans with a potato masher until they reach desired consistency.

name: Refried Beans Without the Refry
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry pinto beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, peeled and halved'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'fresh ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin, optional'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Place beans, onion, jalapeño, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin into a slow cooker. Pour in water; stir to combine.. Cook on High until beans are very tender, about 8 hours; add more water as needed.. Strain beans and reserve cooking liquid.. Transfer beans to a large, shallow bowl. Use a potato masher to mash beans, adding reserved cooking liquid as needed to reach desired consistency.. Enjoy!

name: Instant Pot Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'white onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried Mexican oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dried pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select the Sauté function. Add oil, onion, garlic, and oregano; cook for 5 minutes. Stir in beans and water. Close and lock the lid. Choose high pressure and set the timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Check a bean; if not yet tender, close and lock the lid and cook for 5 more minutes at high pressure.. Drain beans, reserving 2 cups of liquid. Return beans to the pot. Add salt and 1/2 of the reserved liquid; purée using a stick blender, adding more cooking liquid as needed. Use the Keep Warm or Slow Cooker function to keep warm until ready to serve.

name: Frijoles Refritos (Refried Beans)
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'quarts', 'name': 'water, or as more needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'pinto beans, washed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, peeled and smashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'canola oil'}
steps: Combine water, pinto beans, and garlic in a large pot and cover. Cook over low heat for 5 1/2 hours. Stir in salt and continue cooking until beans are very soft, about 30 minutes more, adding more water if needed during the cook time to ensure the beans remain covered.. Heat canola oil in a skillet over high heat. Spoon the beans into the skillet without draining excess water; mash beans using a potato masher until they begin to lose their shape, about 3 minutes.

name: Chef John's Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dry pinto beans, soaked overnight'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole garlic cloves, peeled'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried epazote'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced onions'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced serrano chili pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground dried chipotle pepper'}
steps: Drain soaked beans and transfer them to a stock pot. Add garlic, epazote, and cold water. Place pot over high heat and bring to a boil. Stir. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered until beans are soft, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Drain the beans and reserve all the liquid.. Melt lard in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and salt; cook until onions start to brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Stir in serrano pepper and chipotle powder; cook 1 minute. Transfer drained beans into skillet. Mash about half the beans with a potato masher or back of a spoon. Ladle some bean cooking liquid to skillet. Continue to mash and stir beans as you gradually add more liquid. Mash until the beans have reached your preferred consistency and texture. Taste and add more salt, if desired.

name: Instant Pot® Charro (Refried Beans)
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry pinto beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salsa (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped cilantro, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, minced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'tomato-flavored bouillon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vegetable bouillon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground paprika'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Combine water, pinto beans, onion, salsa, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, garlic, tomato bouillon, vegetable bouillon, chili powder, paprika, cumin, and black pepper in an electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Close and lock the lid. Select Bean/Chili function; set timer for 45 minutes. Cooker will reach high pressure in 10 to 15 minutes.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.

name: Vegetarian Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dry pinto beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomato, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Place beans in a large saucepan and cover with water by 1 inch. Place over high heat and bring to a boil. When beans come to a boil, drain and return them to the same pot.. Cover beans with water by 2 inches; stir in 1 tablespoon garlic, tomato, cumin, and chili powder. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until beans are very soft, about 3 hours and 45 minutes, adding water as needed.. Once beans have cooked, mash them with remaining garlic, oil, and salt; add water as needed to achieve desired consistency. Place over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Refried Black Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry black beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cooking oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green chiles'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Place black beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight. Drain.. Place beans in a pot and add enough water to cover; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer beans until very tender, about 1 hour.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium; cook and stir onion and garlic until onion is soft and translucent, about 10 minutes. Add black beans, green chiles, chili powder, and cumin; cook and stir until flavors blend, about 5 minutes.. Blend black bean mixture in a food processor until smooth. Add tomato paste, chicken broth, vinegar, and salt; blend until desired consistency is reached. Return beans to pot and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes more.

name: Best Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'celery seed'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fire-roasted diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Tapatio)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried Mexican oregano'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}
steps: Put pinto beans into a bowl and cover with 2 inches of water. Soak for 8 hours to overnight.. Drain beans. Transfer to a medium saucepan and cover with water by about 1 inch. Add onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin, celery seed, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 1 1/2 hours.. Use a colander to separate the liquid from the solids. Transfer the solids to a food processor. Add diced tomatoes, hot sauce, oregano, and cayenne; blend to desired consistency.

name: Fat-Free Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'canned black beans, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'liquid smoke flavoring'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced onion'}
steps: Mash 2/3 cup beans in a small bowl to a smooth paste; set aside.. Place remaining beans and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook at a simmer until heated through. Stir in garlic, pepper, salt, and liquid smoke.. Stir bean paste into whole beans until well combined. Add onion and simmer until onion is slightly cooked, about 10 minutes.

name: Rush Hour Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'bacon grease'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'pinto beans, undrained'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}
steps: Heat bacon grease in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot bacon grease until onions are softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Mash pinto beans and cumin into onion mixture using a potato masher until reaching your desired consistency. Cook and stir bean mixture until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.

name: Spicy Cheesy Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'spicy fat-free refried beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic until onion becomes translucent, 2 to 3 minutes.. Cook and stir refried beans into onion mixture until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir cream cheese into bean mixture. Spread mixture into a pie plate; top with Cheddar cheese.. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 20 minutes.

name: Frijoles I
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dry pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'pepper'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}
steps: Soak pinto beans overnight in 1 quart of water.. Place beans into a large saucepan, and add water to cover. Add onions, garlic, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then simmer over medium-low heat until beans are tender, about 1 to 2 hours. Add additional water to the pan as needed to prevent burning.. Mash the beans with a potato masher, and mix in the butter. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is thickened and the butter is absorbed. Adjust seasonings to taste.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread the bean mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish, and sprinkle shredded cheese over the top. Bake for 15 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

name: Buffy's Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'pinto beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Melt the lard in a deep, heavy pot over medium-high heat; when the lard is hot, add the beans. Stir constantly while cooking until the beans reach a paste-like consistency. Season with salt. Reduce heat to low and stir in the water. Simmer and stir until the beans cook down to your desired consistency.

name: Vegan Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'pinto beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'chili powder to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}
steps: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until tender. Stir in beans, tomato paste, chili powder and vegetable broth. Cook 5 minutes, or until stock has reduced. Mash with a potato masher.

name: Ultimate Refried Beans with Cheese
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dry black beans'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'dry red kidney beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground ancho chile pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Oaxaca cheese'}
steps: Cover beans with 4 inches of water and soak for at least 12 hours, or overnight.. Place the pot with beans and water on the stove and heat to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until much of the water has been absorbed and beans are soft enough to mash, about 2 hours.. Crush the beans thoroughly with a potato masher. Simmer for 1 hour more.. Take an immersion blender to the pot and pulverize the beans until there are no visible solids left. If any water remains, simmer until it evaporates and beans are reduced to a thick paste.. Add milk, lard, garlic powder, salt, chile pepper, cumin, and cayenne and stir to combine. Cook for 10 minutes more.. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Transfer beans to a casserole dish and sprinkle with Oaxaca cheese. Cover with foil.. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 20 minutes, removing foil at the 15-minute mark. Serve immediately.

name: Frijoles II
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry pinto beans'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'smoked bacon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Place the beans, sugar, garlic, onion, and bacon into a slow cooker. Pour in the water, cover, and cook on High for 6 hours. Drain off 2/3 of the liquid, and discard bacon. Use a potato masher to mash beans to a chunky consistency. Season with salt to taste, and serve hot.

name: Easy Refried Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Country Crock® Spread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'black beans, drained'}
steps: Melt Country Crock® Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook onion, stirring occasionally, 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in beans and cook, mashing with potato masher or fork, 4 minutes or until desired consistency.
